_metadata.title: Mendix Mobile Development - Complete Reference (Studio Pro 11)
_metadata.description: Comprehensive guide to Mendix mobile app development including native, PWA, and offline-first capabilities

introduction.overview: Mendix supports various mobile app development styles (native, web, PWA) from a single platform with common mobile back-end services.

appTypes.nativeMobile: Distributed via app stores with improved native device capabilities and fast performance
appTypes.progressiveWebApp: Next evolution of web apps, accessed directly from browser without app store download
appTypes.responsiveWeb: Traditional web apps optimized for mobile browsers

introduction.navigationProfiles: Create different channels (responsive, native phone) from a single model using navigation profiles that can be added/removed separately

nativeMobileApps.distribution: App stores (Apple App Store, Google Play)

deepLinks.description: Custom URL schemes (e.g., my-app://) for inter-app communication
deepLinks.usage: Allow other apps to access pages and functionality

locationAndMaps.description: Access user location and display native maps

pushNotifications.description: Server-triggered notifications even when app not running

localNotifications.description: Schedule notifications at specific times without server

augmentedReality.description: Render 3D objects in physical environment via camera

nativeStyling.approach: Set class properties on widgets with JSON style definitions

logging.description: Native apps send logs to Mendix Runtime

webApps.process: Single step deployment to production environment

nativeMobileApps.process: Two steps: 1) Deploy server-side, 2) Build and distribute app

distribution.appStore: Build new version with Native Mobile Builder, release to stores
distribution.overTheAir: Update app elements without releasing new store version

overTheAirUpdates.description: Update pages, nanoflows, JavaScript actions without store release

makeItNative.description: Testing app for viewing native apps during development

debugging.nativeApps: Enable Remote JS Debugging in Make It Native, debug with Chrome

steps: Test with Make It Native app

bestPractices.rationale: Mobile users may have intermittent connectivity
Only sync necessary data to reduce bandwidth and improve performance
Fast startup critical for mobile user experience
Native widgets provide better performance and native feel
Simulators don't capture all real-world conditions
Reduce friction of app store updates for minor changes
